de.systemagmbh.interfaces.logger
Interface ISysLogFormatter

All Superinterfaces:
ISysComponent
All Known Implementing Classes:
ASysLogFormatter, DummyISysLogFormatter
public interface ISysLogFormatter
extends ISysComponent

Let's give a definition of a 'log format' first:
The 'log format' is the way the different information like date, log level, text is composed.
The ISysLogFormatter is the interface, that has to be implemented to get a special 'log format'. It defines the method formatLog. This method is executing the formatting.
The init method is loading information about the formatting (like the date format that has to be used).

Version:
$Revision: 1.17 $
Author:
Udo Friedrich

Method Detail

init

public void init(ISysConfigItem configItem)
          throws ASysException
Call this method to configure the formatter from a section in the configuration.

Parameters:
configItem - The item in the configuration that contains the formatter data.
Throws:
ASysException - if the items needed by the implementation are not available in the configuration.

formatLog

public String formatLog(String componentType,
                        Object toBeLogged,
                        int level,
                        Properties additionals)
This method defines the way, how a logger will format the log output.

Parameters:
componentType - The name of the application part that called the log method.
This is used for the component log levels!
(May be empty if the concret implementation does not need this information.)
toBeLogged - The object that has to be logged.
level - The level that is used for logging the given text.
(May be empty if the concret implementation does not need this information.)
additionals - The parameters for formatting this log output as Properties. These parameters are not set for all the following log outputs. (Use method setProperties for this.)
Returns:
the formatted text that has to be logged.
